item.title: Marcia add a quote by Karen Joy Fowler
item.description: "Every mother can easily imagine losing a child. Motherhood is always half loss anyway. The three-year-old is lost at five, the five-year-old at nine. We consort with ghosts, even as we sit and eat with, scold and kiss, their current corporeal forms. We speak to people who have vanished and, when they answer us, they do the same. Naturally, the information in these speeches is garbled in the translation." -- Karen Joy Fowler

item.title: Marcia add a quote by Charles Darwin
item.description: "If the misery of the poor be caused not by the laws of nature, but by our institutions, great is our sin." -- Charles Darwin
